hackathon-description-text: Hack UCSC is proud to announce its fourth annual hackathon, taking place on January 20 to 22, 2017. It will be held at the Porter Dining Hall, with other classrooms available throughout the event. Friday will consist of registering, eating, listening to the opening speakers, and meeting fellow Hack UCSC attendees. At midnight, hacking begins and will continue until code freeze at midnight Saturday (with meals throughout the weekend, of course!). On Sunday there will be two rounds of judging, followed by the closing speakers and announcement of the winners! This is a great opportunity to meet people interested in the same kinds of software development as you, as well as those with an entirely different set of interests, form teams, and create your very own projects!

hackathon-judges.judge-name: Your judge will come to your table.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First Place: $1,000 + $1,000 Grant from Community Foundation Santa Cruz County for non-profit organization that the first place team chooses + Mentorship from Community Foundation Santa Cruz County+ Lunch with Community Foundation Santa Cruz County Representative + a free Maker Pass to the CITRIS Invention Lab
Up to $300 in Amazon Gift Cards

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Redefine Future of Virtual Closet - Sponsored By Project YX
Google Cloud Platform Prize - Sponsored By Google

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Winner: Xbox One S 1 TB + call with a recruiter
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Microsoft Azure - Sponsored By Microsoft

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First prize: $1000 and lunch meeting with Dean of the Arts, Susan Solt (and relevant faculty) to further explore creative entrepreneurship
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Creative Entrepreneurship - Sponsored By Arts Division, UCSC
Graduate Division - Sponsored By Graduate Division, UCSC

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Winner: Exclusive access to private events during the SHE++ summit in April 2017, including Bay Area tech company tours and the annual SHE++ Mentorship Dinner
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Diversity Hack + Sponsored By SHE++

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment. Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Win a HackHarassment Swag Bag.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Hack Against Online Harassment - Sponsored By Hack Harassment
Best Domain Name - Sponsored By Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of AWS - $250 AWS credit for each team member.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of AWS by MLH
